Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy, I have just had my second cycle of FEC 5 days ago and for me this time the nausea is better but i am much more achy and tired, exhausted tired with little motivation however im hoping in a few days I will have found some energy from somewhere.  I do get terrible flushes which seem to come and go as and when they please :) As far as I am aware I have one more FEC then 3 T's not sure what I think of that lol Take Care Serena
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, not a good day for me today, things were just starting to look up have felt good since last Thursday woke up in agony this morning so much so it made me cry .... pain in arm where piccline is.  Ended up spending all day in hospital turned out I have a large DVT in my upper arm.  I now have to have daily injections for the next 6-9 months. Am so glad I listened to my instincts as I was arguing with myself this morning on whether i was being paranoid, feeling pain that was not there ... maybe I had led funny on my arm in bed etc etc Not sure if this will affect my next treament but im hoping not am due my second FEC on the 17th June.  Seeing Onco this Friday so i guess i will know more then.  Also not sure about the future of my Piccline whether they will keep that in or not as the line itself isnt causing me any problems.  Was a right sod to get in so wouldnt have another one. Has anyone else had a similar issue? Take care
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, though id drop in and give an update on where I am up to. DVT in arm still giving me grief and am on lots of painkillers for this - apparently it can take 3 weeks before it starts to feel better, I still cannot lift my arm due to the pain it caused in my armpit and upper arm.  Im managing the daily injections okay though. I should have been due 2nd FEC on the 17th June however Oncologist wont allow me to have it because of my DVT, he also said its probable that the piccline needs to come out and advises I have a HIckman line in instead.  Im not sure about this given my current circumstances. I started losing my hair around day 10 post first FEC and its just coming out in clumps all over so lastnight my other half gave me a number 2 so thats that sorted :) only trouble is I cant make my scarf cos i only have i working arm.  Hopefully things will be looking up soon and i can get back on track with my chemo. Hope everyone else is managing their treatment  without as much drama lol xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, Really need some advice of possible. I had my first FEC a week ago and am still suffering terribly with my tummy its making me really miserable.  Im not even sure what is it, its not nausea, I am going to the toilet albeit with help from Bisacodyl. The only way I can describe it is a very full and uncomfortable feeling in the very upper part of my tummy - the section between my breast and tummy button and my stomach is about 4 sizes bigger than normal.  I feel if  could get this settled I would feel relatively okay.  I am getting to the stage where I am contemplating eating as this only makes me feel more uncomfortable ...... obviously im not going to do that. I am struggling to get a gp appointment so any advice in the meantime would be great. Thanks in advance x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks for the responses regarding my tummy problems.  I ended up seeing the doctor on Thursday and have been prescribed 2 other medications.  The doctor believes its gastritis caused by the chemotherapy and the steroids.  On a more positive note I feel better in myself as i have felt pretty rotten since my first FEC.  My main problems being the nausea and my tummy but hopefully we will have this cracked for next time.  My next FEC is due on the 17th so I can enjoy myself from now till then. Any advice on my fingernails? ... my nails are really squidgy? Thanks as always
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen ... welcome to the club :) Its a great source of advice especially when you are at the start of your chemo and you don't know what to expect.  Everyone on here is so lovely and friendly and someone always has an answer to questions or queries.  Hope your nausea remains settled xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi, Just wanted to give you some positive news.  I was recently diagnosed with Grade 3 invasive ductal cancer, its also triple negative so treatment options are currently surgery, chemotherapy and radiotherapy. I had a radioactive injection this morning followed by a lumpectomy and sentinel node removal and I have to say it was nowhere near as bad as i anticipated it to be. I had worked myself into such a tizzy for nothing - I was treated with respect and dignity and I cannot fault the care and treatment that I have received so far. The treatment options today are excellent and it may be a bit of a tough journey at times but we will come through the other side and are all here to support each other. xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen, I have found it really helpful to stick with my usual routine as I too am used to being in control.  I have continued to work up until my surgery which i had on Monday I need some time ff now to recover but I will return to work when I can.  I am still trying to do what I can at home etc. Continue with your bike ride if you can xx Continue to use the Forums for support, we are all here for each other ... no matter what time of the day or night ;) Regards xx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I just wondered how do we actually find out whether the cancer had gone after chemo and radio etc have finished.  Are we sent for repeat mammograms etc or are there other ways to find out this?  I notice a lot of people have CT Scans is this what they are looking for?
Posts.Title: How do we know?

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, looking for some hope and inspiration here :).  I had my first T on Weds and nothing could have prepared me for the pain that I am now experiencing, I am literally hurting in every orrifice and can just about shuffle around.  I am using co-codamol - what is everyone else using to help? My temp is fine which is a good sign.  Is it normal to feel like this .... i feel like someone is grinding all of my bones and joints together.  Would welcome any advice big hugs to all xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Lizzy re: toothbrush I bought a softer toothbrush and run it under hot water first.  I also found that corsordyl burnt quite a lot I was advised by district nurses to ask for Difflam which works much much better x
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LizzyRascal, thanks for your reply, I actually ended up in hospital for a couple of days but am back home now and definitely not looking forward to the next T.   Ended up on co-codamol and tramadol to manage the pain.  I am on the once only injection the Neulasta a lot of people have said that this can cause the aches but I had this with all 3 FEC and nevr did it cause so much pain so I think it is the T.  I am seeing the Oncologist this week on the 20th so will ask for some strong painkillers I think, I cannot have Ibuprofen which i think may have helped due to a DVT so will ask for an alternative. The symptoms seem to have settled now (lol nearly time for the fecking next one)  some residual symptoms like ... very sore feet ... strange i know, fatigue and rectal bleeding .... oh the joys :) My periods have also stopped which has made me very weepy I must cry about 10 times each day and dont even know why :)
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, I have 1 more radio to go and I am not taking any medication due to being Triple negative and I also feel the same.  I believe mine is the taxotere that is still in my system that is causing the joint pains.  I am hoping that 1 day I wake up and feel pain free xx
Posts.Title: Quality of life 7 weeks in??
